intro: Ugni friedrichsthalii, commonly known as the Andean huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. It produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisine and traditional medicine. Ugni friedrichsthalii thrives in cool, humid environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
